  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>
            <entry>oai:melt.cup.cam.ac.uk:cahi1:data_107594</entry>
          </identifier>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>lre</catalog>
            <entry>cahi1:data_107594</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Models of atoms</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Modelle der Atome</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Modèles des atomes</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Modelos dos átomos</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Modelli degli atomi</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Μοντέλα των ατόμων</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Modelos de átomos</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">These illustrations show models showing electrons moving along a fixed orbit around the nucleus of an atom (left) and electrons moving in a fuzzy orbitals around the nucleus of an atom (right).</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">atomic theory</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Atoms</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Electrons</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">hydrogen atoms</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">hydrogen molecules</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">orbitals</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildungen zeigen die Modelle, welche die 
Elektronen zeigen, die entlang eine örtlich festgelegte Bahn um den 
Kern eines Atoms bewegen (nach links) und die Elektronen, die in 
flockige Orbitals um den Kern eines Atoms verschieben (recht).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Ces illustrations montrent des modèles montrant 
des électrons se déplaçant le long d'une orbite fixe autour du 
noyau d'un atome (à gauche) et des électrons déplaçant dans les 
orbitales brouillées autour du noyau d'un atome (droit).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Estas ilustrações mostram os modelos que 
mostram os elétrons que movem-se ao longo de uma órbita fixa em 
torno do núcleo de um átomo (à esquerda) e os elétrons que movem 
no orbitals fuzzy em torno do núcleo de um átomo (direito).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Queste illustrazioni mostrano i modelli che 
mostrano gli elettroni che si muovono lungo un'orbita fissa intorno al
nucleo di un atomo (a sinistra) e gli elettroni che spostano nell'i 
orbitals sfocati intorno al nucleo di un atomo (di destra).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτές οι απεικονίσεις εμφανίζουν μοντέλα που 
εμφανίζουν τα ηλεκτρόνια που κινούνται κατά μήκος μιας σταθερής 
τροχιάς γύρω από τον πυρήνα ενός ατόμου (αριστερά) και 
ηλεκτρόνια που κινούν τα συγκεχυμένα τροχιακοους γύρω από τον 
πυρήνα ενός ατόμου (δεξιά).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Estas ilustraciones muestran los modelos que 
muestran los electrones que se mueven a lo largo de una órbita fija 
alrededor del núcleo de un átomo (a la izquierda) y los electrones 
que mueven en orbitarios borrosos alrededor del núcleo de un átomo 
(derecho).</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Atomtheorie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Atome</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Elektronen</string>
          </keyword>

          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>

          </keyword>

          <keyword>
